page.title: 08N.S.TOURIST CENTRE
page.content: Within easy travelling distance of the town there are many beautiful places.There are clean,sandy beaches close by.The beaches are away from the road so they are quiet and safe for young children to run about on.Inland there is a deer park,a deer museum and a wild goat park.The wild goat park and the deer park are very large fenced enclosures where the animals are perfectly free to roam about.Near these parks is Clatteringshaws,a large dam and reservoir,part of the Galloway Hydro-Electric Scheme.The road that passes by this place is known as the Queens Way.The Forestry Commission has made forest walks and picnic sites for tourists and local people to enjoy.Anglers,antiquarians,artists, botanists,cyclists,geologists,hikers, mountaineers_all would find Newton Stewart a good centre.
